newsitem.title: POLAND: Espebepe rebounds sharply after dive.
newsitem.headline: Espebepe rebounds sharply after dive.

text.p: Polish debt-ridden construction company Espebepe SA jumped 8.1 percent to four zlotys, rebounding after last week's 46.4 percent fall as speculators continued to play on the firm's uncertain future, traders said.
"That's the play of speculators because there's no fundamental reason to invest in the firm," one trader said.

Earlier this month Espebepe, which has 75 million zlotys in debts and faces the risk of bankruptcy, had a creditors meeting postponed to April 14, and uncertainty over its future left plenty of room for speculative play, traders said.
Buying was stronger for the stock after price-fixing on Monday.
